intro: Psychotria iodotricha subsp. multiflora, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded forest understories. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and striking red bracts that enclose small, white flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are edible and often consumed by various wildlife species. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
